learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate production practices used in commercial nursery crop production.
Outline the factors that shape the fruit production industry with reference to the cultural and management practices associated with perennial fruit crop production.

Outline the contemporary issues that shape the vegetable industry with reference to the cultural and management practices for a range of warm and cool season vegetable crops for the fresh, processing and export sectors of the vegetable industry.
Outline the factors that shape the floriculture industry with reference to the cultural and management practices for floriculture production.
Evaluate the positive and negative interaction of invertebrates with horticulture crops pre- and post-harvest.
Describe key postharvest factors that influence fruit and vegetable quality and shelf life and the techniques used to reduce fresh produce losses/wastage.
Prepare a solution proposal addressing a contemporary challenge relating to production horticulture.
Communicate scientific solutions clearly in both written and spoken forms to a general audience.

assessments.task_description:
Interest in robotics (automated technology) is increasing in the horticulture sector due to a number of reasons, but particularly due to challenges associated with sourcing human labour for repetitive tasks. As the development officer of a medium to large horticulture enterprise, prepare a proposal for your manager for the implementation of robotics (automated technology) into a production sector of the company to improve productivity. To complete this assignment, you may find it useful to first explore the definition of robotics (automated technology), then select a horticulture industry of your choice (e.g., nursery, floriculture, vegetables or fruit) and for a particular enterprise (e.g., stone fruit orchard, hydroponic strawberry farm), research a production task/process that would benefit from the use of robotics.

Note, selecting a production task/process where robotics (automated technology) are not already commonly used will demonstrate a higher level of critical thinking. For example, equipment that is used to sort individual fruit by weight and colour are commonly used in packing sheds, however, you may find equipment designed for packing lines with new capabilities and benefits that would be appropriate for this assignment.

 

Guide for preparing the proposal

Background

Outline the horticulture industry you have selected and explain the horticulture practice/process you have chosen and why robotics (automated technology) should be considered. Economic factors are likely to be the main motivation, however, other horticultural, social and environmental factors should be considered. (200 words)

Proposed robotics

Describe how the horticulture task/process can be accomplished with robotics (automated technology). Ensure that you include scientific, plant/crop physiology, literature to support your argument. For example, if a robot is used to prune fruit trees, explain the scientific reason for the removal of wood, i.e., yield and tree health. (800 words)

Benefits and constraints

Describe the benefits and constraints of using robotics (automated technology) for the particular horticulture task/process you have chosen. The benefits could include production advantages, improved/consistent quality, workplace safety, economic and social gains, and environmental sustainability. The main constraint is likely to be cost, however, other constraints should also be identified and justified. Ensure that you use scientific literature and reports from reputable sources to support your statements. For example, you could research the injuries associated with a manual task the robotics (automated technology) would replace or perhaps the robotics (automated technology) themselves will introduce new safety problems. (1200 words)

References

The majority of your papers should be published within the last 10 years. You are welcome to use any referencing style, provided you are consistent, or you may use the style set by the American Psychological Association style (APA). The most recent version of APA is the APA 7th style. https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/referencing/apa7

General Presentation

Your proposal should contain images. However. links to videos will not be suitable as the marker will not access content contained in links.

Your assignment should contain headings and subheadings for clarity, and images (with sources referenced).

Length: 2200 words +/- 10%, not including in-text references, reference list and figure captions.

Machine Translation (MT) may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of MT in each instance.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) in this task is prohibited.

A failure to reference MT use and / or the use of generative AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to prepare a proposal and justification for the introduction of a new crop for cultivation under Australian climatic conditions. As a horticulture consultant working for a company in Australia you are tasked to explore a possible new horticultural crop that could be suggested to growers, as an alternative to existing commodities crops (such as avocado, citrus, table grapes, mango, etc.), for those that would like to diversify their production base. This crop should be resilient and be adapted to unpredictable climates, particularly dominated by increased temperature and water scarcity. The produce should have the potential to be marketable to consumers that demand sustainably produced, high-quality products, and have strong export potential.

 

Guide for preparing the report

Introduction

Identify, introduce and justify the importance and benefits associated with the production of the proposed crop. You will need to search the literature, and ideally include statistics and scientific information from the literature to provide a reasoned and clear argument for growing the new crop you have selected. You should also highlight any gaps in the current knowledge. In the final paragraph, restate why the crop should be introduced, including how the new crop will benefit the horticultural industry. (300 words)

Body

Describe the environmental and other production requirements, whilst also considering ecological adaptations that make this crop a suitable choice. Based on the growing requirements of the crop, consider the regions where the crop could be grown in Australia. Identify possible markets and other financial, social and environmental benefits associated with this new crop. Also, highlight any challenges that you foresee with the introduction of the crop, and possible solutions to overcome such hurdles. (2050 words)

Conclusion

Summarise the main points covered in your report and restate the relevance of your proposed crop to the horticultural industry, society and the environment. (150 words)

Reference list

The majority of your papers should be published within the last 10 years. You are welcome to use any referencing style, provided you are consistent, or you may use the style set by the American Psychological Association style (APA). The most recent version of APA is the APA 7th style. https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/referencing/apa7

General Presentation

Your report should be prepared with headings and subheadings to provide structure and clarity. The case study should be typed using 12-point Times New Roman / Calibri /Arial and 1.5 line spacing.

Length: 2500 words +/- 10%, not including figures, tables, and reference list.

Machine Translation (MT) may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of MT in each instance.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) in this task is prohibited.

A failure to reference MT use and / or the use of generative AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
Students are required to prepare a 15-minute PowerPoint presentation based on your 'Introduction of a new crop' assignment. In this assessment task, you will give a mock presentation to your company CEO or Board of Directors stating the crop you have identified, the benefits of introducing the new crop for the company and consumers (e.g. new markets), the changes (e.g. labour, equipment, technology) that would need to be made to introduce the new crop, limitations and potential solutions. Conclude by restating the benefits of the new crop to the company, the horticulture industry, the environment, and society.

Students enrolled in External mode must record their presentation and the camera of your computer must be on and your face shown live (in a small box) the entire time as this is an Identity Verified assessment.

 

Guide for preparing the presentation

For a 10-minute presentation (plus 3 mins for questions), aim to have no more than 10 slides, excluding a title slide and a reference slide. Your slides should include the following:

Introduction

Provide a concise overview of the topic and outline the main sections you will be covering in your presentation.

Body

For your new crop, you should include new scientific findings - such as current technologies, new developments, and recent research. Research data should be presented clearly using graphs and/or tables. You should critically review the data you present and compare the results to other studies, where possible. Include in-text references to acknowledge sources where necessary.

Conclusion

Summarise the main points of your presentation and restate the benefits of the new crop.

Reference list

Include a list of references, on a separate slide, at the end of your presentation. You are welcome to use any referencing style, provided you are consistent, or you may use the style set by the American Psychological Association style (APA). The most recent version of APA is the 7th edition.  https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/referencing/apa7 

General advice Your presentation should be reportable in a 10-minute time slot.

PowerPoint presentations should be visually attractive and use images to explain your points rather than typed words. Keep word use to a minimum and use a clear font, such as Arial or Courier. Avoid reading directly from slides as it prevents you from connecting with your audience.

Practice your presentation beforehand. Use language that is listener-friendly and scenarios that people can easily relate to. Pretend that you are describing your work to your parents or your best friend who is not necessarily a horticulturist but is educated and interested. Add a little humor to keep the presentation entertaining and interesting. Use voice tone and hand gestures to transmit information.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
